title: Red Sox reportedly place reliever Jordan Hicks on IL after latest implosion
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox place reliever Jordan Hicks on 15-day injured list due to a shoulder injury.
Hicks has struggled with an 8.20 ERA over 21 appearances for Boston this season.
Chris Murphy expected to join the team as Hicks recovers, following 8-1 loss to Guardians.

title: Derrick White gets candid about ‘different’ season that awaits Celtics
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Boston Celtics face a challenging 2025-26 season with Jayson Tatum out due to an Achilles injury.
Celtics traded key players Jrue Holiday and Kristaps Porzingis to manage luxury-tax constraints this offseason.
Derrick White emphasizes adapting to changes as the team forms a younger core after losing several starters.

title: Report of suspicious man approaching Arlington child ‘unfounded,’ police say
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Arlington police closed the investigation into a masked man allegedly approaching a boy, deeming the report 'unfounded.'
The 11-year-old reported being approached by a masked man in a vehicle on Waldo Road, but ran away safely.
Chief Julie Flaherty confirmed insufficient evidence was found after interviews and surveillance footage review.

title: Man who threatened pro-Palestinian protesters in Cambridge facing assault charge
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Matthew Freeman of North Billerica charged with assault and battery with a dangerous weapon and a civil rights violation.
Freeman allegedly brandished a hatchet and struck a protester with his car door at a Cambridge protest.
Prosecutors added a misdemeanor civil rights violation charge on September 2 in Cambridge District Court.

title: Patriots’ Will Campbell lands on injury report ahead of season opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots' rookie left tackle Will Campbell was a limited participant in practice due to an ankle injury.
New England faces a potential lineup issue with both cornerback Christian Gonzalez and tackle Will Campbell potentially absent.
Defensive tackle Christian Barmore was limited in practice for non-injury reasons as the team eases his return.

title: Invasive seaweed stinks up one of the North Shore’s favorite seaside spots
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Good Harbor Beach in Gloucester emits a rotten egg-like odor due to decomposing invasive Japanese seaweed.
Hurricane Erin's strong winds washed heterosiphonia japonica ashore, where it decomposes without strong tides to remove it.
Invasive seaweed first appeared on the East Coast in 2008, spreading from Rhode Island to Nova Scotia and Long Island.

title: Police: Suspect caused ATM explosion in Woburn, prompting FBI investigation
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: A suspect caused an ATM explosion at Eastern Bank on Mishawaun Road, Woburn, on Thursday morning, police reported.
The device used in the explosion was possibly a pipe bomb; FBI and State Police Bomb Squad investigated the scene.
The suspect fled the scene and remains at large; no injuries were reported, and police state there's no current public threat.

title: Canton man arrested in Dorchester murder
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Jordan Evans, 32, was arrested for the May murder of Shakar Caterson in Dorchester, police reported.
Evans was apprehended on Revere Street in Canton for charges including murder and firearm violations.
Caterson was found shot near Blue Hill Avenue, Dorchester, on May 3 and died in the hospital.

title: New England governors back wind energy as Trump escalates his attacks on industry
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: New England governors, including Massachusetts' Maura Healey, urge Trump Administration to support offshore wind projects already permitted.
Trump Administration's actions against offshore wind include halting Revolution Wind and reconsidering SouthCoast Wind permits.
New Hampshire's Governor Kelly Ayotte, a Republican, signed a law removing support for offshore wind development in the state.

title: Read a statement from the fiancé of Shrewsbury father shot and killed after walking son to school
author: Sana Muneer
bullets: Kevin Doherty, 56, was shot and killed on August 28 after walking his son to school in Shrewsbury.
Snehal A. Srivastava, 26, allegedly shot Doherty on a bridge at Jordan Pond during a graffiti incident.
The Shrewsbury community plans a memorial vigil and fundraiser for Doherty on October 11 at SAC Park.
